item.title: The Future of Housing
item.description:
New research looks at the currently low level of housing permits, which may provide insight into the future of the housing market.

The post The Future of Housing first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
New research looks at the currently low level of housing permits, which may provide insight into the future of the housing market.

The post The Future of Housing first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: Classic Cars on the Road
item.description:
American car owners are replacing their vehicles less frequently. Learn how that could affect auto manufacturing employment.

The post Classic Cars on the Road first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
American car owners are replacing their vehicles less frequently. Learn how that could affect auto manufacturing employment.

The post Classic Cars on the Road first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: A Closer Look at Inflation
item.description:
Energy, health care, and housing may be pushing down our low rate of inflation: Is it weaker demand or stronger supply that’s at work?

The post A Closer Look at Inflation first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
Energy, health care, and housing may be pushing down our low rate of inflation: Is it weaker demand or stronger supply that’s at work?

The post A Closer Look at Inflation first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: Paychecks at the top, at the bottom, and in the middle

item.title: Is fear chilling the economy?
item.description:
Like rolling a 6-sided die and having a 7 come up… This 3-part essay examines the lingering effects of the Financial Crisis and how we now think about risk.

The post Is fear chilling the economy? first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
Like rolling a 6-sided die and having a 7 come up… This 3-part essay examines the lingering effects of the Financial Crisis and how we now think about risk.

The post Is fear chilling the economy? first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: BoJ Assets
item.description:
Central banks have purchased long-term bonds to lower long-term yields, but the Bank of Japan has taken it to epic proportions.

The post BoJ Assets first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
Central banks have purchased long-term bonds to lower long-term yields, but the Bank of Japan has taken it to epic proportions.

The post BoJ Assets first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: What Do the Markets Hear When the Fed Speaks?
item.description:
A recent Review article by Kevin L. Kliesen, Brian Levine, and Christopher J. Waller analyzes the impact of Fed communications on key financial market variables.

The post What Do the Markets Hear When the Fed Speaks? first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.
item.content:encoded:
A recent Review article by Kevin L. Kliesen, Brian Levine, and Christopher J. Waller analyzes the impact of Fed communications on key financial market variables.

The post What Do the Markets Hear When the Fed Speaks? first appeared on St. Louis Fed Economic Research.

item.title: St. Louis: Growing Slowly
item.description:
